entry.title: Edit Large Files
entry.summary:
Few weeks ago, I split a large file (30GB, text file) into smaller files (6GB) using split in order to load in to postgres. However, smaller files had partial lines at the beginning and at the end and postgres copy didn't like it at all. Removing first and last line was not straight forward as I thought.

Surprisingly, Nano, Vi and Emacs have failed to handle 6GB text file (or I didn't have patience to wait for them to finish) and ended up using awk and head.

Remove First 'n' lines

awk 'NR > n' BigFile.txt > BigFile.txt.tmp
mv BigFile.txt.tmp BigFile.txt

Remove Last 'm' lines

head -n -m BigFile.txt > BigFile.txt.tmp
mv BigFile.txt.tmp BigFile.txt

entry.title: Install 'Fabric' on Windows
entry.summary:
Easy

If it works, pretty easy to do with pip

$pip install fabric

Trouble

Trouble started when I got an error while installing fabric on windows. Error seems to come from building pycrypto library.

running build_ext
building 'Crypto.Random.OSRNG.winrandom' extension
warning: GMP or MPIR library not found; Not building Crypto.PublicKey._fastmath.

error: Unable to find vcvarsall.bat

After scrolling through few webpages found a solution on StackOverFlow where it suggests to do following

>SET VS90COMNTOOLS=%VS100COMNTOOLS%

or

>SET VS90COMNTOOLS=%VS110COMNTOOLS%

Depending on your VS installation, and then

$pip install fabric

It gives following error, Argh !

build\temp.win32-2.7\Release\src\winrandom.pyd.manifest : general error c1010070
: Failed to load and parse the manifest. The system cannot find the file specifi
ed.
warning: GMP or MPIR library not found; Not building Crypto.PublicKey._fastmath.

error: command 'mt.exe' failed with exit status 31

Again after scrolling few pages, found an answer on fuyun 's website.

For the sake of completeness, I have quoted his/her solution.

Now try to build it again. I got this error:

buildtemp.win32-2.6Release_mysql.pyd.manifest : general error
c1010070: Failed to load and parse the manifest.
The system cannot find  the file specified.

error: command ‘mt.exe’ failed with exit status 31

To fix this problem, go to C:\Python2.6\Lib\distutils,
edit msvc9compiler.py, search for ‘MANIFESTFILE’, you will find the following line

ld_args.append(‘/MANIFESTFILE:’ + temp_manifest)

Then append the following line after the above line,

ld_args.append(‘/MANIFEST’)

then

$pip install fabric

entry.title: Pelican
entry.summary:
Experience

Pelican is a nice library for generating websites where you can use reST to write html pages. Primarily, I choose to use pelican because I can use emacs to write reST pages and rst is painless to write compared to plain old html. In this post, write my experience of getting this site up and running with pelican. Hopefully, it will help someone like me to get started on using pelican. Since this is my first few iterations with pelican settings file looks primitive. Please feel free to send along suggestions for improvements.

Install

Once pip installed straight forward to install 'pelican'.

$ pip install pelican

Settings file

# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
AUTHOR = 'Dinesh Weerapurage'
AUTHOR_SAVE_AS = False
SITENAME = 'Overheards, thoughts and tech'
SITEURL = 'http://weerapurage.org'
TIMEZONE = 'US/Eastern'

GITHUB_URL = 'https://github.com/xydinesh/xydinesh.github.com'

DISQUS_SITENAME = "weerapurageorg"
PDF_GENERATOR = False
REVERSE_CATEGORY_ORDER = True
LOCALE = "C"
DEFAULT_PAGINATION = 4
FEED_ALL_RSS = 'feeds/all.rss.xml'
CATEGORY_FEED_RSS = 'feeds/%s.rss.xml'

SOCIAL = (('twitter', 'http://twitter.com/xydinesh'),
      ('github', 'http://github.com/xydinesh'),)

# global metadata to all the contents
DEFAULT_METADATA = (('yeah', 'it is'),)
# Default theme
THEME = 'notmyidea'

Themes

There are good number of pelicen themes available on github where you can fork/clone them and use. Just need to modify settings file (which I called settings.py)

THEME = '../pelican-themes/notmyidea-cms'
